subject: Re: [junit] test cases for inputs from file
msgSnippet: ... You lost me there. According to the source code (TestCase.java), the setUp(), testXXX(), and tearDown() are all run in the same thread... public void
messageBody:
Jonathan Gossage wrote:

>Exactly. Since Junit runs each test in an independent thread and runs the
>setUp() and tearDown() methods in the main thread this ensres that
>everything is synchronized and that tests do not stomp on each other.
>

You lost me there.

According to the source code (TestCase.java), the setUp(), testXXX(),
and tearDown() are all run in the same thread...

public void runBare() throws Throwable {
setUp();
try {
runTest();
}
finally {
tearDown();
}
}

What am I missing?

Mike
